surface_layer.definition: A rapid loss of plasma confinement and thermal energy in a Tokamak reactor.

deep_layer.mechanism: Magnetohydrodynamic instabilities grow nonlinearly, leading to stochastic magnetic fields, which cause a thermal quench and current quench.

capabilities: Causes rapid loss of plasma confinement
Causes mechanical stress on the reactor

MECHANISM: Nonlinear growth leads to stochastic magnetic fields
Stochastic magnetic fields cause thermal quench
Stochastic magnetic fields cause current quench
